meta_data.title: The Forgotten Behind the Scenes Crew of the Bible
meta_data.subtitle: Galatians 6:11 Thanks to everyone who supports TMBH at  You're the reason we can all do this together!  Music by

transcription_data.text: the everybody's that this is the ten minute by the lower podcast and i did something i don't do very often with my family last week i took them all to a concert a big fancy show at an arena with loud music and live performance and an artist that i have always wanted to see perform somebody i've looked up to and liked for a really long time and i'm not gonna tell you who was which is weird and now i'm teasing it there's a point all of this the reason i'm not telling you is because we're putting out like maybe right now maybe it's already out i don't know if you're hearing this but we're putting out an episode on no-dome questions the to dudes talking show that i do with my buddy deston and it's about the concert and i don't want to ruin it because i met the artist afterwards with my son and it is pretty cool is pretty meaningful and that's what the episodes about so i'm not gonna spoil it with who we went to see but it was awesome and what kind of amazed me about the show beyond just how great it was and how impressive it was that this artist could do all these things i've heard them do for all these years they could do it live what impressed me was the operation i got a little bit of a look at the bowels of the arena and what it takes to put on a show that this is like a three-hour event we've got these two artists an opener in the actual the main act up on the stage it's maybe three hours and there is a massive crew that obviously comes with the musicians but there's a massive crew that makes the event go concessions and maintenance and security and tickets and i don't can you there were just shirts everywhere that said you know we we work here staff or whatever it was wild to think that a three-hour event has that much planning that much effort that many man hours that go into making it happen and years from now when i think back on the show i'm probably only gonna picture the main artist maybe i'll remember the opening act i definitely won't picture the faces of any of the hundreds of people behind the scenes that were required though to make this really impressive but very short event happen likewise when you picture the bible there are a bunch of really big names of authors and people are with my like moses and luke and paul and john but as we're seeing here in passages like elation six eleven that says see what large letters i use as i write to you with my own hand it's paul saying that we have these moments where we have curtain pulled back a little bit and we realized dang there's like a whole cast and crew behind the bible that made this go there's all these people whose names we don't know we don't remember their hint at we can tell they were involved but we don't know who they are and it's just an indicator of how god built the bible so the bible holds itself out as being inspired by god but overtly written by people which means the fingerprints of god are all over the bible the internal cohesiveness the theological consistency the accuracy the reliability but also the fingerprints of humanity are all over the thing i mean you just spent all this time in Galatians with me it's very human paul is clearly a part of this writing process so it's not like god man i don't want to venture into like blast familiar anything here but i'm just going to try to say what i'm trying to say here it's not like god possessed paul and took over his will and his personality they had a human puppet and he moved paul around and made him seem like he was a person but he was actually just possessed by god this sounds so dark and weird sorry i think i'm maybe not even supposed to say this stuff i don't it's so wrong but that just isn't what the bible holds itself out is doing at all i mean the personalities of all the characters are on display the meticulousness of luke is on display the detail-oriented older recollections of peter i think probably are coming through in mark the gentleness and grand fatherliness of old man john is coming through in the johannian epistles that's a really fancy way of saying the letters that john wrote so the bible that both what it claims about itself what we know from history and what it shows itself to be internally is very incarnational just like god took on flesh and the person of christ jesus so also the bible kind of takes on flesh it's human and it's from god and it's reliable and it's super intended to do exactly what god wants it to do using human genres using human methods and structures of writing that writings are built out of to be created for example you got psalms well it's not like one guy sat down and wrote psalms there were a lot of songs that a lot of people wrote about god that were all really really good during that time but at some point the editorial process of picking which ones of these songs would make it into the collection was christians believe it's the jews believe it was guided by god it's exactly the right list nailed it great job the proverbs lots of people wrote the proverbs we know several of the author's names some of them probably many of them we don't know who wrote them they were collected by somebody who did the curating on all of this i mean it says the proverbs of solomon son of david so at least some of these are overtly by solomon maybe the rest are gathered by him but we don't know there's ambiguity to it well i think that's kind of cool because how else would a collection of proverbs or songs happen other times you've got genealogies you've got letters you've got books of prophecy that are mingled with narrative luke for example tells us exactly how he wrote luke and then the story of the early church acts he says i could i just went and asked people i used historical methods to figure out what was actually going on here well the audience would have wanted to know that because luke wasn't an eyewitness to the events of the life of jesus he would have had to have done research so the bible my point is the bible is never shy about exactly what it is at every turn and yet somehow while being completely forthright about how it was made and showing that it was made it also absolutely claims to be from god and somehow there's this union of the superintendents of an all-powerful all-knowing god with the fumbling and groping around of humanity at certain points it intersects and it creates this document now look the best argument i have for the reliability of the bible is an internal argument if you take the time to do what we're doing right now it holds up and i'll tell you this straight up i am more sure of the reliability and truth of the bible now than when you and i met i think it more now than when i started this podcast and i think i really thought it hard when i started this podcast but i've just seen so much in these years with you nothing else i've ever read and i've read great material the best material from human history none of it hangs together like this and all that great material i've read from human history was all written by like one guy at one time in one sitting this shouldn't work it shouldn't hang together the way it does with all these authors overall this time and with all these people behind the scenes and we don't like the cast and crew who we don't even see or know but who get alluded to from time to time like what we see here toward the end of Galatians it just shouldn't work so well and it does and then you also consider like the external evidence and stuff and i don't know i'm just i'm very very compelled by the bible obviously because i want to talk with you about it every single day and i think it's super interesting also i don't think it's magic and this is a passage that reminds me of why i don't think it's magic i don't think this is a book that just descended from heaven it's frustrating there's certain threads of christianity that like to pick fights with other threads of christianity and sometimes they'll throw this out as some dumb straw man pejorative toward people kind of from my part of the christian family tree like you people think that they could just came down from heaven one day and no we don't it's in the text we can tell where it came from we're not idiots you can read the bible and figure out where the bible came from it gives you a pretty good sense of how it was made it isn't magic it's bigger than that it's more important and more impressive than magic it's super intended by a god who is held out as being bigger than earth and reality and nature and existence as we think of those things giving him the ability to do something that is really approachable and really readable that a person could make sense of and that's full of relatable human experience and that was composed and written in a way or if you sat and thought about you'd be like i guess that'd be how you'd have to write something like that it's completely understandable relatable and approachable but also there's every page smacks of the stuff of the divine something that is so so so much bigger so i love it when we get these little break the fourth wall pull back the curtain moments of the bible if you've been hanging out with me for any amount of time you know that i think this stuff is awesome because i highlight it all the time and i love that my conviction is this the god of existence i am himself ordained that paul would be the kind of guy who would respond to galatia just this way and the problem there and then he'd be the kind of guy who at the end of this letter is like give me the pen give me give me just no i'm serious i can get this part i'm fine i can see well enough give me the pen and then he takes the pen and he writes down basically the whole gist of the letter he just got done doing but only in like five or six sentences just make sure you got it and that you saw it in paul's own hand writing and i love that dance between those two things the the very temporal and the very human and also the supernatural because of the way the bible is made in that dance is in that way it's it's exemplary of it's a demonstrative of the the very relationship between me and god humanity and god you sit around you think to yourself well how could there ever be union or any kind of right standing or any relationship between the infinite and the finite just when you really stop and think about it that seems like it would be impossible and then you pick up the bible and it's all kind of one big answer to that question well i guess like this i guess this is a little glimpse into what it might look like for there to be a relationship between the infinite and the finite the infinite's going to do the heavy lift but the finite isn't just snuffed out in the midst of all of this it's redeemed it's made useful it's given purpose it's made an agent and an air not just something passive and so it's an old saying i got to wrap this up i've been going too long but there's an old saying the medium is the message the idea is that the how a thing is communicated or the medium by which a thing is communicated is a big part of what is being communicated and i think that's true with the bible when you really look at the guts of it the nuts and bolts of it the little peaks behind the curtain like we get in Galatian 611 see what large letters i use as i write to you with my own hand a passage like that that kind of stuff teaches that kind of stuff is part of what the point of the bible is that is the nature of the bible is modeling the hope that the bible overtly talks about on its pages and overtly in the words that are written down as well do that make sense that was fun for me to process that through anyway once again if you want to know what cool artists i've always wanted to meet who i met and i went to this concert you can check out notom questions we'll link it below it's not like i even get anything for this it's not like there's some great big call to action i just think you might get a kick out of it and i don't want to ruin it because i think it's a great episode that i recorded with my buddy about that so i'm just not going to tell you here you can check that out if you want to either way we are moving forward into paul's really big important restatement and wrap up stuff that's going to be one great final check for you and me to make sure we got Galatians and it's in our hip pocket before we wrap this thing up and move on to the next season which is finally man all right that's plenty for now i'm matt this is the 10 minute bible hour podcast let's hear this again soon you
